item.title: Colophon
item.description:
Colophon

Here are some details about how this website is maintained and published:

  • This website runs on a Debian system.

  • This website is served using Nginx.

  • This website is generated statically using a small Common Lisp program. This program is available under the terms of the MIT license.

  • Every line of HTML and CSS that makes this website is handcrafted. The final HTML pages, however, are generated using a Common Lisp program. This program merely combines the handcrafted HTML content with a handcrafted HTML layout to generate the pages that are served over the web. The content HTML, layout HTML and the Common Lisp program were all written from scratch.

  • All web pages on this website are validated using HTML Tidy.

  • While most of this website is made of static HTML pages served via Nginx, the pages for the comment and subscriber forms are dynamic in nature. They are implemented using Common Lisp and Hunchentoot.

  • This website has a site-wide page list that includes every page on this website. It doesn't matter if the page is part of a blog, a standalone HTML tool or an HTML game. Every single web page on this website occurs in this list.

  • This website has a links page that has pointers to various sections of my website.

  • This website has a tag list page that can be used to browse this website by topics. Clicking on any tag on the tag list page, presents a list of all web pages that have been marked with that tag.

  • This website provides a consolidated web feed (RSS). The Common Lisp program mentioned earlier ensures that every new web page that appears on this website also appears in this web feed.

  • Every tag has its own web feed. For example, see tag/technology.html for a list of all pages tagged "Technology" and then see tag/technology.xml for the corresponding web feed.

  • The web feeds are sparingly styled with XSLT. Web browsers that support XSL transformation for web feeds render the feeds as HTML (rather than raw XML) as determined by the stylesheet.

  • This website has an old-fashioned guestbook. Feel free to leave a message there if you would like to say hello or share a thought.

  • This website includes a blogroll generated by a small Common Lisp program. It reads the RSS and Atom feeds of my favourite blogs and generates a page with links to recent entries. This has turned out to be a pleasant and effective way to keep up with my feeds, so much so that I no longer use any dedicated feed reader software or aggregator services. See also: My Blogroll Is My Feed Reader.

  • Every directory and subdirectory on this website has a directory listing page that lists all its files and subdirectories. See ls.html for an example. Subdirectory names are marked with a trailing slash.

  • This website loads KaTeX to render LaTeX snippets on web pages that contain mathematical formulas. For example, see the page integrating-factor.html. KaTeX is not loaded on other web pages.

  • All internal links on this website are relative links. In fact, all internal resources like the stylesheet, KaTeX, etc. too are loaded using relative links. Doing so allows me to browse this website locally from my local drive without having to run a web server on my development system.

  • All web pages on this website have been validated to ensure that there are no broken internal links.

  • When you visit any web page on this website, all resources are loaded from this website and only this website. No external resources are loaded. This ensures that when you visit this website, no data about your client is transmitted to another web server.

  • This website does not load analytics scripts.

  • This website does not use cookies.

item.title: Privacy Notice
item.description:
Privacy Notice

Susam.Net (this website) is a personal website maintained by Susam Pal. This privacy notice explains how this website uses the data it collects from you when you use this website.

Data Items

This website collects the following data:

  1. The text submitted by you if you submit a new comment to this website. This text submitted by you may contain your name, a URL to your profile on the world wide web and a comment. This text is written by you, so you are in complete control of what you submit in the text. You must not submit sensitive personal data to this website.

  2. Your email address submitted by you if you submit a subscribe or unsubscribe request to this website.

  3. Your Internet Protocol (IP) address used to visit this website.

  4. HTTP referrer URL sent by your web browser or client software while connecting to this website. A web browser or a client software typically, but not necessarily, sends the URL of the web page or website where you clicked on a link to visit this website as the HTTP referrer value. If this website is visited directly without clicking on any link, then a web browser or client does not typically send any HTTP referrer data.

  5. User agent string sent by your web browser or client software while visiting this website. A web browser or a client software typically, but not necessarily, includes the names and versions of your device and operating system as well as the name and version of your web browser or client software in the user agent string.

Data Collection

When you visit this website, your IP address, referrer data and user agent string are automatically recorded in web server log files.

When you submit a new comment to this website successfully, your text is written to a file on the web server. If the comment submission fails due to errors, then your text is neither saved nor published. If the comment submission succeeds, the text submitted by you is reviewed within 30 days. If your comment is found to be suitable for this website, then the text you have submitted is published on the website. If the comment is found to be unsuitable for this website, then the text file containing your submitted text is deleted.

When you submit a new subscribe or unsubscribe request to this website successfully, your email address is written to a file on the web server. If the request submission fails due to errors, then your email address is not saved. If the subscribe or unsubscribe request succeeds, the email address submitted by you is added to a Google Groups mailing list that is used to send email newsletters. The use of your email address by Google Groups is covered by Google's privacy policy.

Data Usage

The IP address, referrer data and user agent string is used to monitor abuse of this website such as submitting spam comments, sending too many requests to reduce the availability of this website, etc. This data is also used to mitigate abuse of this website by blocking certain combinations of IP address, referrer data and/or user agent from accessing this website or by limiting the number of requests such a combination may send to this website.

If you submit a comment to this website successfully and if the comment is found to be suitable for this website during review, the comment text is published at a comments page on this website. Whether a comment is published or not is at the discretion of the maintainer of this website. When your comment text is published on this website, it becomes available publicly to anyone who visits the comments page. You must not submit sensitive personal data to this website.

If you submit a subscribe request to this website successfully, then at the discretion of the maintainer of this website, your email address may be added to the email newsletter recipient list. The recipient list is maintained in Google Groups, a third-party service provided by Google LLC. This website uses Google Groups mailing list to send email newsletters. The mailing list is configured to not expose your email address to other subscribers. The use of your email address by Google Groups is covered by Google's privacy policy.

If you submit an unsubscribe request to this website successfully, then your email address is removed from the Google Groups mailing list within 30 days if the email address exists in the mailing list. You can remove your email address immediately from the Google Groups mailing list by sending an email to susampal+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.

Data Storage

The IP address, referrer data and user agent string are stored in web server log files. This data is retained for 15 days. After 15 days, this data is deleted automatically.

A successfully submitted comment text is first stored in a text file on the web server. The comment text is reviewed within 30 days. If the comment is found to be suitable for this website, the comment text is copied to a comments page where the comment becomes available publicly on the world wide web. If the comment is found to be unsuitable for this website, then the text file containing your submitted text is deleted from the web server. You must never submit sensitive personal data to this website.

A successfully submitted email address in a subscribe or unsubscribe request is first stored in a text file on the web server. The email address is reviewed within 30 days. At the discretion of the maintainer of this website, a successfully submitted subscription request is either accepted or rejected. When a subscription request is accepted, the email address is added to a Google Groups mailing list that is used to send email newsletters. After adding your email address to the mailing list, the text file containing your email address is deleted from the web server. The mailing list is configured to not expose your email address to other subscribers. When a subscription request is rejected, the text file containing your email address is deleted from the web server. A successfully submitted unsubscribe request is always accepted within 30 days. The email address submitted in an unsubscribe request is removed from the Google Groups mailing list within 30 days if it exists in the mailing list. Then the text file containing the email address is deleted. The use of your email address by Google Groups is covered by Google's privacy policy.

Third-Party Services

If and only if you successfully submit a request to subscribe to the email newsletters of this website and your subscription requested is accepted, your email address is added to a Google Groups mailing list used to send email newsletters. Google Groups is a third-party service provided by Google LLC. The use of your email address by Google Groups is covered by Google's privacy policy. Google's privacy policy is available at policies.google.com/privacy.

Third-Party Analytics

This website does not use third-party analytics.

Cookies

This website does not use cookies.

Marketing

This website does not use your data for marketing purpose.

Contact

If you have any questions about the data collected by this website, please contact susam (dot) pal (at) gmail (dot) com.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
About Me

Hi! I am Susam Pal. Welcome to my website. This page provides a brief introduction about me and this website.

I am a software engineer by profession. I have a keen interest in free and open source software. My first non-trivial contribution to open source was NUTCH-559 in 2007. That contribution added support for various authentication schemes to Apache Nutch, an open source web crawler. I have remained active in the open source communities since then. I also develop and maintain a few open source projects of my own at github.com/susam. For a list of my projects, see my open source work details.

When not involved with technology, I like reading books, playing the piano and travelling.

IRC

I am usually online as my IRC nick susam on Libera IRC. I hang out at various channels like #algorithms, #commonlisp, #emacs, #python, etc.

The #algorithms channel was founded by me first on Freenode in 2007 when there was no such channel dedicated to the subject of algorithms. It started as a tiny community of about 10 members from the ##math channel and then gradually grew to have over 200 members within a few years. The channel was then migrated to Libera in 2021.

Website

This website is generated using a Common Lisp program. Most of this website is static in nature. The comment form on this website is served dynamically using a tiny web server program written in Common Lisp. See github.com/susam/susam.net for the source code of this website.

Every line of HTML and CSS that makes this website is handcrafted. See colophon.html for more details about how this website is written and run.

The primary copy of this website is hosted at susam.net. A mirror of the website is hosted at susam.github.io.

This website began its life as an intranet portal running on an intranet server out of my dorm room during my university days back in 2001-2005. That intranet server was named maze. I used to run that server for my fellow students in our university's computer network. The server used to host an FTP server and an HTTP portal for mathematical puzzles, technical articles, free software downloads and audio/video streaming. While that intranet portal and its source code written in Classic ASP are now long gone, some of its content still survives on this website.

Browse

The home page of this website presents my primary blog. I write about technology, mathematics and other miscellaneous topics on this blog. The posts on my primary blog often tend to be long-form, involved and detailed. They sometimes take considerable time to write and publish. As a result, the interval between two posts on this blog can range from several weeks to months.

I also archive notes, code and various miscellaneous files on other sections of this website that I update more frequently than my primary blog. Visit links.html to find quick links to my primary blog as well as other sections of this website.

Guestbook

This website has a simple, old-fashioned guestbook. Please visit guestbook.html if you would like to leave a comment.

Blogroll

This website has a blogroll. On a particularly hot summer day in June 2025, with temperatures soaring to 31 °C, I decided to write a small Common Lisp program that generates a page with links to recent entries from my favourite blogs. To check my blogroll, please visit roll.html.

I have found this to be a great way to keep up with my feeds. Thanks to this section of my website, I no longer use feed readers or aggregators. I could never quite make a habit of using them regularly anyway.

Credit for this nifty and very effective idea of using my blogroll as my feed reader goes to Alex Kladov! It was Alex's website, matklad.github.io, that inspired me to implement my own blogroll.

Colours

This website supports both light and dark colour schemes. The information box below shows the colour scheme selected right now.

The light colour scheme is active currently.

The dark colour scheme is active currently.

If you would like to browse this website using the opposite colour scheme, please check if your operating system or web browser supports changing the preferred colour scheme. Most modern operating systems do support it.

Name

I have been told many times that my name, "Susam", is a little unusual which makes it difficult for others to figure how to pronounce it. It is pronounced almost like the English words "sue sum" (/suːsʌm/). However you may call my name however you find most natural, convenient or intuitive. I do not mind mispronunciations of my name at all whatsoever.

Bugs

If you find any bugs, typos or errors on this website, please report them to me by sending a comment.
